turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: To us. To the Mask.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: To our...partnership.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You're nervous again.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: When I was a girl my father took me to the edge of El Capitan. Three thousand feet of granite. Straight down. I was so scared my mouth was full of cotton. I couldn't talk, just stood there shivering...like this.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You were afraid of heights?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Terrified. Still am.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: How in the devil did you do the Rembrandt then?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I had a lifeline. If I've got a lifeline, I'm okay.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Aren't we all.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: My father told me not to be afraid. He'd always be there for me.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: He wasn't.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: So you had to be your own lifeline.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Something like that.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: And--

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: He pulled back his arms and blam, I landed right on the floor. I picked myself up, tears in my eyes, and he looked at me and he said, Son, don't ever trust anybody. Anybody.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Camera in the--

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Bookshelf. Sensors--

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Popup, on floorboards. And--

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: In eye of that painting.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: We're working.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: It's a party.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Let's mingle a little, shall we?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: One, two, three...

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You're not on the beat.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Don't turn. I'm counting the steps to the entrance.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: These rooms are solid stone. They haven't changed.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: You can't be too careful.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Yes, you can.  You can spoil a perfectly nice dance.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Ready?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Ready.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Can you see the other PIRs?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Got it.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: They moved it.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Behind you.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Be careful not to break the laser beams.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Duh.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Careful...careful.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: We did it.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: The Mask.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Now's when you tell me who you really are.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You're playing both sides of the street. You're going to keep the Mask and turn me in.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: No, no, please God, you're wrong. I'm a thief. Just like you.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Okay, you're a thief.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Yes. Yes.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: What do I need a thief for? I've got the Mask.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: STOP! You're making...mistake.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It's your mistake.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: The big job.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: There is no big job.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: A billion dollars.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Your share.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Get the hell in.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: We're living history here.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: You don't know the half of it.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I like banks.  That's where the money is.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Speaking of money. You said billions. How many?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: If you want a partner, I think you should recalculate the split.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: No, really, it's your plan, you should get at least 30 per cent--

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: My eighty, your twenty, smart guy--

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It's fifty-fifty, less the cost of the dress.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Come on, what can you do with six billion you can't do with four?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Hold the record. Alone.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Hmmm...44 long.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I always knew you'd do the job.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You've got everything planned.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Everything.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I'll need the Rembrandt now.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Sure, it's only worth 25 million or so, don't bother telling me what you're going to do with it.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I told you. It's the down payment. And thanks to you it's overdue.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Insidious thing, wondering if your partner...has another partner.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Okay, look, I'm delivering this to a man who's going to give us the key to our job. But it's pointless to try to explain it yet. You just have to trust me. I don't have any more secrets.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Everyone has secrets, it's what makes us human.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Idle hands, the devil's workshop.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: There's food in the fridge. I won't be long.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: The Mask. Where is it?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You took the Rembrandt, I figured it was a fair trade.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Do you know what you've done!? Do you know?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Would you quiet down! Just for a minute?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Oh my god, I thought--

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I'd taken the Mask?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: What about the rules?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: My job, my rules.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Well...What are we doing?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: You're being useless. I'm making us rich.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Currency data so we can do optimum conversions at the moment of transfer.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Transfer.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: The eight billion. From them to us.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Right. The eight billion.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Guest lists of every A-list party on turnover night. They'd be handy to disappear into, so we're invited to all of them.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Peoples China Bank.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Where the money is.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: It's taken me five years at Webber Insurance, nights, weekends, every spare minute, to make this CD. It has all the necessary instructions and confirmation codes to tell their computer to transfer reasonably modest sums out of thousands of those accounts, two, or three million at a crack. Total, eight billion and change.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: And the money goes--

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Every wire transfer gets rocketed through a series of multiple switches. As soon as each deposit lands somewhere, it's shot somewhere else. It ends up so clean the Mafia couldn't find it.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: But those instructions, they're recorded in the computer.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Nope. The CD instructs the computer to replace those instructions with an innocuous loan coded XJ-6.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: A parting gift from the Empire.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Sit down, I'll show you how we're going to do it.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: The oscilloscope's already programmed.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It's no good without the argon gas.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Got it.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Then the vault, how to get in the vault, that's stumping me.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: That's where the Mask comes in.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You've thought of everything.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: So how long till we do this?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: We're doing it tonight.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You can't be serious.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: That's the beauty of it. There's only one tiny window of time when this will work. At the handover of Hong Kong--from Britain to China. The handover from them to us.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You're out of your mind. We can't do a job like this with no rehearsal.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: There's no way to practice this. And no time. Besides, I've planned it all. There aren't any surprises.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: There's always a surprise.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I've covered everything. And you're the best, so--

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You're overestimating yourself again. What's worse, this time you're overestimating me.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Look, there's a video security system to bypass, that's the only hard part. You've done that a dozen times.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: For God's sake, the only way I can get from one elevator to the other is to jump.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Feeling old?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: How do I look?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Like a woman of mystery.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Access codes to the vault are changed daily, passwords for our computer on the hour...

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Can't be too careful.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Two men in the world don't need passwords or codes. Their retinas will scan to unlock everything. one of those two men is the chairman of the bank.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Let me guess. His retinal plate is in there.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Pulse detectors.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Charged.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Parachute.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Packed.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Done.  And I assume you have the magic CD- ROM?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Surgically attached.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: No way to take another day or two?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: No. You'll see when we get inside.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You shouldn't have.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Can't break tradition. It's bad luck.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: There is one more thing.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: You have something in mind?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Call it a new tradition.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: That was a lifetime ago.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: It was wrong to deceive you.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: But that's all behind us now.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: But would you--would you--

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Have really held you under?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Of course not. It was just a negotiating ploy.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Nothing like fear of drowning to focus your attention.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: So what are you going to do with your share?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Oh, I don't care about the money.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Four billion dollars.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Seen one billion, seen them all.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: That's because you grew up rich.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: A flaw in your research, my dear. I grew up chewing shoe leather for breakfast.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Not for me.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: What? Another job? Stealing the Eiffel Tower?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I'm going to disappear. I die in a car crash in Taiwan. Very easy to do.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: They drive so recklessly there.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I'm leaving from the Nathan Road Station at 6:30 tomorrow morning. You could come too.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: The sign of our partnership.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Brought us luck once, maybe it will again.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: And when, eventually, everyone discovers what transaction XJ6 was really about...

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: China will think it happened before midnight. Britain will swear it happened after midnight...

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: They'll each be positive the other guy did it.  I fear an ugly international incident.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Jesus God, it's going through.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Hong Kong midnight, happy new year. Except at China Bank.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Relax, don't jam it...

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: FUCKING THING!!!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Don't panic, now, there's no rush...

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: We can't leave it IN THERE, it's got all our accounts, everything that can NAIL us to a goddam CROSS!!!

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: MOVE IT, WHAT ARE YOU WAITING F...

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: The disc is still in there.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: We can't help it, we...we've gotta...

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: The door's the only way out!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I sincerely hope not.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You can do it.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: No way.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Go!

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Hang on.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Get out of here!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I cannot get rid of you.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: No, you can't.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Put this on!

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I'm not leaving without you.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: What's wrong.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Nothing is wrong. Everything is the way it has to be. In my left coat pocket is a packet. Passports, hotel reservations, tickets.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Take the airport subway, but change at Jordan Station for Kowloon Tong.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: But--

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It's only ninety seconds up the line. You're on a connection to a trans Siberian express.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: What about you?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You have the right to remain silent. But anything you say may be taken down in evidence and used against you--

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: My god--

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: --You're a cop.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Both sides of the street, I'm afraid.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: He looks familiar.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: That would be Thibadeaux. The cop I work for every now and then. Catching thieves. The really good ones--the ones who imitate me.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: They've been on to you all along. Knew you had a big job going.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: You gave them the eight billion.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You mean the seven billion.

turns.speaker: QUI
turns.text: A true master. Classic, yet extremely sexual, don't you think?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: We need to make the trade tomorrow.

turns.speaker: QUI
turns.text: Always in a rush.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: You should know, when I come back here with the Mask--if anything goes wrong, a detailed description of everything you've done goes to the PRC.

turns.speaker: QUI
turns.text: Gin, really.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Tomorrow. It has to be tomorrow. Or forget the Mask.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: I'm not real big on collecting banged up Ferraris at airports.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Next time I'll use valet parking.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: They work off the O2 tank just like the slice pack.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Which is--

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: In the van.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Tina was a wonderful woman.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: Don't go getting sentimental. You're no damn good at it.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I'd give you a hand but it wouldn't look good.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: Yeah, the lord of the manor doesn't haul his own groceries.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: And you do it so well.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: The porta power...comm kits...got the IR/Thermo camera?

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: Had to get a liquid plasma screen.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: The key to success is using the right tools.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: You're not the one trying to get all this shit. You think they've just got a Crooks R Us on every corner?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: We're going to need a vacuum with a battery pack for the dust. The air filters might be wired. And a bypass hose for the AC.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: Sure wouldn't want you to be uncomfortable.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: If we don't bypass it, the temperature in the Mask room will change and set off the alarm. That would be inconvenient.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: Inconvenient is trying to find a pulsing laser with magic arms in two days.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You are a miracle worker.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: We might not want to cash in our chips just yet. She has another job after this one. A big one.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: This is big enough.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It's never big enough.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: Let me ask you, this Mask, when they made it--was the old bitch dead or alive?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It's a death mask. Death mask means dead.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: Because I never assume anything.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I need you to get one more thing for me. A dress, elegant but sexy, something Grace Kelly would wear. Maybe a Balenciaga.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: That's it, I sure as hell ain't no personal shopper.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Black of course.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I'd say she's a size 6 who wears a size 4.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: This better be worth 1t.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Oh, it is.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: It better be worth it for me.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I said a masked ball, not a costume party.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: How the hell I'm supposed to know the damn difference?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You look like George Washington.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: I cannot tell you a goddamned lie. She's selling you a pig in a poke. We better do this tonight.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It's too soon.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: The early bird gets the damn worm.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: But the second mouse gets the cheese.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: So patience, Thibeau, patience. Trust me.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: Remind me why.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Because it pays off.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: You two make quite a couple.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: We're supposed to.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: You better not be taking on a new partner.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Suspicious, after all these years?

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: You change partners, you change the rules.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Oh, look at me, darling. I thought this gentleman was a waiter.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: You damn well thought wrong.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I'm terribly sorry old man.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: Tonight your league night?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Check out my ball.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: Doesn't look like much. How come those Commos want it so bad?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It's not just art, it's history. Something you Americans don't care about--because you haven't got any.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: That's because we live in the future. Which is what's on my mind.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: This is just show and tell.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: I'm waiting for the tell part.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: She's calling the shots now.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: You're impressed with her, aren't you?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: She's good. Give her that. Almost as good as she thinks she is.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: She reminds you of yourself. There's nobody you admire more.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: My antenna is up, it is fully extended, and I am picking up...what is it? It is, can it be? The boy is in el, u, v.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It's never happened before. What makes you think it's happening now?

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: You better be keeping your mind on business. It's not just me you got to worry about. I've got some very unpleasant folks looking over my shoulder.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You know where my loyalties lie.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: To yourself, that's where.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You'll just have to have faith.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: Faith is angels dancing on the head of a pin. I got to have trust.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: She won't tell me everything. It's a bank job, that's all I know.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Thirty-five next generation microchips. Copper, not silicon. Value: one million each.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: You're giving them to me?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Call it an expression of trust.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: Thought you had to use some of these.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You don't really think I'd leave ten million dollars worth of our chips in her bag?  What matters isn't what's real. It's what we <u>think</u> is real--what matters is the art.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Take this mask. It may look like the Empress, but it's not.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: I figured that out.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: The face decays, the mask doesn't. Art lasts, we don't. That's why art's so valuable. It's a little piece of immortality.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: You got a real problem with priorities, you know that?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I really don't think that's a topic on which you have much to offer.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: Did I ever tell you what Tina wrote? The night she died?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: My friend, you always surprise me.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: We wear so many goddam masks after a while they get stuck to our faces, you know? And they don't come off. But when you find the one person who really knows you, and then you lose her...

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: Takes a lot out of you, one like this.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Yes it does.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: I been meaning to tell you, far as I'm concerned you're over the hill.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: See you.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Probably not.

turns.speaker: THIBADEAUX
turns.text: Yeah. Probably not.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: ... what we do in here is keep track of all the case files.  That way, at any time, we can find out a case's status -- where it is in the office, stuff like that.  We file 'em all here, alphabetically --

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Oh, hell.  I'm dyslexic.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: That's a joke, right?

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Anna?  With this real-estate valuing stuff - - could you remind me, cause I'm a little confused about how exactly we do that.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Erin, you've been here three weeks.  If you don't know how to do your job by now, I am not about to do it for you.
